item.title: EC2 Key Pairs Fingerprinting
item.description: Ever happened to you that you wanted to know which SSH key you need to connect to an AWS EC2 instance? I always found that the fingerprints don’t tell me much, espcially because I always forget how to compute the fingerprints. Good that I’m back to writing, so I’m dumping my memory here: if the key was generated by AWS, then use openssl pkcs8 -in path/to/key.pem -nocrypt -topk8 -outform DER | openssl sha1 -c if the key was generated using ssh-keygen then use openssl rsa -in path/to/private/key -pubout -outform DER | openssl md5 -c Why does AWS uses one format and why SSH other?
